page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { Hartford and Barnton}have many interesting historical sites. Among them are: { Hartford Hall}was built in the 16th century as a nunnery. Among the legends about it is one that a nun was murdered and now haunts the reception area. Another says there was a passage from the Hall to Vale Royal Abbey where some monks lived. Hartford Hall is now a three star hotel. { Anderton Lift}was designed by Edwin Clark. It connects the River Weaver and the Trent and Mersey Canal and is now the only barge lift in the world. It opened in July 1875. It used to be operated by water but in 1907 it became electrically operated. In 1975 extensive renovations were undertaken but it now needs restoring if it is ever to work again.
